general: This law makes sure that schools give information about how much their uniforms cost so parents can plan and budget better. It helps families know what they need to save up for and avoid unexpected costs. The goal is to make it easier for kids to go to school without financial stress on their families.

series.short: "School Uniform Guidance: Costs and Policies Regulated by Law"
series.text:
* Simplified point 1: The Education (Guidance about Costs of School Uniforms) Act 2021 requires the Secretary of State to provide guidance to schools in England regarding the costs associated with school uniform policies.
* Simplified point 2: The guidance must cover all aspects of school uniform policies deemed relevant to the costs of school uniforms by the Secretary of State.
* Simplified point 3: The appropriate authority of a school (governing body or proprietor) must have regard to the guidance provided by the Secretary of State when developing and implementing a school uniform policy.
* Simplified point 4: The Secretary of State may revise the guidance at any time.
* Simplified point 5: The Act applies to England and Wales, and comes into effect two months after its passage.

summary: The Education (Guidance about Costs of School Uniforms) Act 2021 helps ensure that schools in England provide clear information about the costs of their uniform policies. This includes details on the prices of different items, how often they need to be replaced, and any financial assistance available to families. The law also requires schools to consider this guidance when making decisions about their uniform policies. This means that parents will have a better understanding of the costs involved and can make more informed choices about their child's education. Additionally, the government can update the guidance whenever necessary to reflect changes in the cost of living or other factors affecting school uniforms. Overall, the purpose of this act is to promote transparency and fairness in school uniform policies, so that every student has access to quality education regardless of their family's financial situation.
single:
• The Education (Guidance about Costs of School Uniforms) Act 2021 requires the Secretary of State to provide guidance to schools in England regarding the costs associated with school uniform policies.

• The guidance will cover any aspect of school uniform policies deemed relevant to the costs of school uniforms by the Secretary of State.

• The appropriate authority of a relevant school (i.e., the governing body or proprietor) must have regard to the guidance when developing and implementing a school uniform policy.

• The Secretary of State may revise the guidance from time to time.

• The Act applies to England and Wales.

• The Act comes into force at the end of two months following its passage.

• The Act may be cited as the Education (Guidance about Costs of School Uniforms) Act 2021.
